name: Hotel Goya

reviews.title: Great location, simple accomodations, clean.
reviews.text: Near the cathedral, in a nice part of town. Nothing fancy, but clean and accommodating. Would return.

reviews.title: Great Location, Clean and Modern
reviews.text: Surprised to read some bad reviews but our experience during a recent weekend in Seville was good. Apart from the emailed rate being quoted as 65euro for a double, the web page subsequently stating 55euro (the hotel honoured the web rate) everything else was fine and certainly good value for money.The location is great, right near the Catedral and within a short walk of plenty of restaurants and bars. The room was modern and clean albeit a touch small. Bathroom was clean with a good powerful shower. Overall very good value if you want a no frills, clean room right in the centre of this lovely city

reviews.title: Unpleasant experience!
reviews.text: Single room was tiny; hallways smelled of cigarette smoke; walls were extremely thin & all the noise from the halls came into the room; Internet only in the lobby, not in the rooms; very loud construction on the 4th floor every day from before 9 a.m. until the evening. Also, when I booked my room, I asked whether breakfast was included & the man on the phone assured me that it was & that it was "very good." But when I got there, I was informed that I would have to eat breakfast "on the street."

reviews.title: Just the "Oye" in Goya
reviews.text: Let's see, the room was recommended by satisfied customers, but when we got there, the very odd guy at the front desk, quoted a much higher price. As we were short on time we stayed, then it gets interesting: we were given a room that wasn't cleaned, in fact it had someone else's belongings in it. We were eventually given another room. The odd front desk guy kept my passport, I had to ask for it - no one else has ever done this. When we tried to leave for a visit in the town, the front was locked as the front desk guy had gone inside the hotel. Being locked inside a building is definitely a bad safety problem. The walls are paper thin, and in the middle of the night, a strong sewer odor permeated the floor, from somewhere in the the building. We had the windows open, because the air conditioning didn't work, making the sewer smell even worse. There are so many lovely reasonably priced placed to stay all over Spain - avoid this one, it was the only bad one during a great two week trip from the south to north of Spain.

reviews.title: loved it!
reviews.text: The hostal has been reformed and its just like staying in a hotel but without the breakfast, the quality is that good! A must stay for anyone, location is superb, 2 minutes walk from the cathedral and many bars and restaurants, plus the old centre of seville. Not cheap but you get excellent service and a good nights sleep

description: Located in the famous Santa Cruz, the hotel is located only a few meters from the Cathedral and the beautiful gardens of the Real Alcazar.The Hotel Goya is a family-run establishment located in a typical Andalusian architecture building. It has a stylish interior and features a traditional tiled floor. The modern rooms all have free Wi-Fi.The hotel's location is perfect for exploring the historic center of the Andalusian capital.
